channel.title: TypeHints on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in TypeHints on Memo Tut

item.title: Try type hints
item.description: # Overview PEP 484: Type HintswasintroducedinPython3.5.Formoreinformation,seeOfficialDocumentTypeHintSupport. Recently, I’ve heard a lot of stories introduced in the community. I would like to proceed with the introduction in future projects, and I will put it here as a reference for my own study and explanations to other people. Type hints were introduced in Python 3.5 and above as a Python grammar. It’s a hint, so it doesn’t affect anything at runtime No built-in official tools tool There is a de facto check tool called mypy (it can be installed with pip) Supports editors such as PyCharm, code interpolation becomes powerful, and it also checks Effective only at the place where the hint is written (in module or function) The more you write the hint, the more effective the code interpolation and the more you check it mypy cheat sheet
